SENT.plain: Primary malignant lymphoma of the ovary is a rare tumor (1,5% of ovarian tumors)
Clinically, it occurs as an abdominal mass with pain which can be confused with an epithelial ovary tumor
Most tumors are observed during the fourth decade
Burkitt lymphoma, is sporadic in western countries, usually with abdominal involvement
Diagnosis is guided by biological analysis and imaging
Prognosis depends on medullary and neuromeningeal involvement
We report a case of a young woman who developed abdominal Burkitt Lymphoma mimicking advanced-stage bilateral ovarian cancer
